name: Rachel Frances Parker
pob: McKenzie, Butler County, Alabama, United States of America
pod: McKenzie, Butler County, Alabama, United States of America
bio:
Rachel Frances Parker was born and raised in southern Alabama, living primarily in the Butler and Covington County areas.

Parents: She was the daughter of Samuel Parker Jr. (1807-1873) and Rachel Francis Mason (1812-1904).

She is buried at the Bethel Primitive Baptist Church Cemetery in Babbie, Covington County, Alabama.

Rachel came from a large family and established a significant branch of the Parker-Hartley line in Alabama.

Census records show that Rachel lived in various parts of southern Alabama throughout her life, specifically in Election Precinct 11 (Westover) and Red Level in Covington County, before returning to McKenzie in Butler County where she passed away.

Frances Emma Hartley is buried at Bethel Primitive Baptist Church Cemetery (also referred to as Bushfield Cemetery) in Babbie, Covington County, Alabama
